archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
did.abstract: Publications and one poster generated by Diane Elliott Gayer's development of Vermont Design Institute, Historic Main Street Partnership Study in Burlington, Vermont, and Colorado Left Bank Townhomes.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Diane Elliot Gayer Collection, Ms2002- Special Collections, University Libraries, Virginia Polytechic Institute and State University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated to the Special Collections by Diane Elliott Gayer, November 2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Diane Elliott Gayer, architect involved in groups including Women in Design and Women in Architecture, expands the expectations of what architecture can do and builds a more sustainable future based on community empowerment. Gayer, educated at the University of Colorado, is Director of the Vermont Design Institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Diane Elliott Gayer Collection (1997-2002) is comprised of publications, a community study, a curriculum vitae, and a poster.
Vermont Design Institue publications include "The Vermont Design Quarterly" Vol.1 - Vol. 4 (1998-2001), and the Historic Main Street Partnership Study (2001.)
Also included is a publication detailing The Left Bank Townhomes created by Principal Architect Gayer at Artimis Designs, Inc. in Denver Colorado.
The poster, entitled "Racial Justice & Equity" was designed by Gayer (1997) for the Burlington, Vermont Peace and Justice Center.
Also included in the collection is Gayer's curriculum vitae.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by format.

scopecontent.p: September 18, 2002 letter to Milka Bliznakov discussing Gayer's work philosophies and interests as well as contents of the donation.
Brochure detailing Artimis Design, Inc. town home plan in Denver, Colorado.

did.unittitle: Historic Main Street Partnership Study August 2001

scopecontent.p: Assessment of Historic Buildings, Site and Parking, & Wayfinding along Main Street in St. Johnsbury, Vermont.
